hackathon-description-text: WiCHacks is an all women 24-hour hackathon hosted by Women in Computing at RIT. A
hackathon-rules:
1) All hacks must be started AFTER hacking begins.
2) Any software or hardware from a third party MUST also be publicly available to use by anybody else.
3) Do NOT steal anyone else's source code.
4) Judges make the final decision on any winner of a prize.
5) Have fun, learn something, and make something awesome!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: Amazon Gift Cards and HubSpot water bottles!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Teaching Programming Hack by Hubspot

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: 2nd gen Philips Hue Lightstrip Plus's
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Women & Gender Issues Hack by Viacom

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: An Amazon Echo for each teammate!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Rookie Award by Bank of America

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: A portable Bluetooth speaker (Clip2) and a quick charge external battery (Mophie Powerstation) for each teammate.
$3k in Amazon Gift Card credit shared amongst the team

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hardware Hack by Liberty Mutual
Most Novel by Women in Computing at RIT

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A Google Home for the team!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack for Social Good by JP Morgan

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Prize: A lilypad development kit (open source hardware)
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Open Source Hack by Red Hat

hackathon-description-header: WiCHacks is a collaborative programming event in which participants can create an app, website, game, or any other project over the course of the event.
